intro: Telipogon chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found primarily in the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as red, orange, or yellow. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to biodiversity and supporting pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
